item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker
